metadata.title: CVE-2022-22594 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A cross-origin issue in the IndexDB API was addressed with improved inputvalidation. This issue is fixed in iOS 15.3 and iPadOS 15.3, watchOS 8.4,tvOS 15.3, Safari 15.3, macOS Monterey 12.2. A website may be able to tracksensitive user information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22594` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.35.2-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.35.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.35.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.35.2-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.35.2-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.35.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.35.2-1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
wpewebkit package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
